# Exploring My Data Science Topic

In this blog post, we will explore and analyze a specific data science topic. The goal is to provide insights into the problem, the data, and the solution. Throughout the analysis, we will use the R programming language.

## Data Loading

Let's start by loading the dataset for our analysis.

```{r}
# Load necessary libraries
install.packages("tidyverse")
library(tidyverse)

# Load the dataset
data <- read.csv("C:/Users/shrav/Downloads/Consumer_Complaints (1).csv")

# Display the first few rows
head(data)

# Summary statistics
summary(data)

# Create a scatter plot
ggplot(data, aes(x = Complaint_ID, y = ZIP_code)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(title = "Scatter Plot of Complaint ID vs ZIP code")

barplot(table(data$Product), main = "Bar Plot of Categorical Variable")


## Missing Values
# Identify and visualize missing values
library(visdat)
vis_miss(data)
